document.docAuthor: ZHOU, YU-LINGZI, BORDONI, ARNALDO & ZHOU, HONG-ZHANG
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of the genus Megalinus Mulsant & Rey (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae, Xantholinini) and seven new species from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of the genus Megalinus Mulsant & Rey (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae, Xantholinini) and seven new species from China

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of the genus
Megalinus Mulsant & Rey
from China .

paragraph.keyLead: - Head normally punctate, without a narrow median longitudinal impunctate ridge................................... 8
- Lateral margins of pronotum parallel or slightly sinuate....................................................... 4

3 Mesoscutellum bearing isodiameter meshes.................................................
M. xingxing Bordoni

- Mesoscutellum bearing transverse microstriae..............................................
M. coracinus (Zheng)
4 Pronotum densely punctate, just with a median longitudinal impunctate region..................................... 5
- Pronotum with paired admedian rows of punctures and paired lateral rows........................................ 7

5 Distance between rows of punctures on pronotum ca. 1/2 of puncture diameter...............
M. punctatissimus (Bordoni)
- Distance between rows of punctures on pronotum ca. puncture diameter.......................................... 6

- Temples sharply dilated at posterior 1/4................................................
M. taipingensis (Bordoni)

7 Body dark brown, except last abdominal segment yellowish..................................
M. pandarum (Bordoni)
8 Median lobe of aedeagus distinctly elongate, length/width> 1.70................................................ 9
- Median lobe of aedeaugs subspherical or elliptical, 1.20<length/width<1.70...................................... 16

9 Paramere possessing hook-like structure..................................................
M. metallicus (Fauvel)

11 Temple of head substraight...............................................
M. nonvaricosus Zhou & Zhou
sp. nov.
- Temple of head somewhat dilated or distinctly dilated........................................................ 12

12 Lateral portion of pronotum bearing numerous rows of punctures......................
M. solidus Zhou & Zhou
sp. nov.
- Lateral portion of pronotum bearing one row of punctures.................................................... 13

13 Male tergite IX with dark stout spines in inner margins....................................
M. bicatellatus (Bordoni)
- Male tergite IX without dark stout spines in inner margins.................................................... 14
14 Interspaces between head punctures less than two punctures’ diameter........................................... 15

- Interspaces between head punctures more than two punctures’ diameter.......................
M. zhenyuanensis (Zheng)

15 Posterior margin of male terigte VIII slightly emarginated or subtruncated.......
M. liupanshanensis Zhou & Zhou
sp. nov.

- Posterior margin of male terigte VIII medially emarginated..........................
M. ningxiaensis Bordoni
,
sp. nov.
16 Median lobe of aedeaugs subspherical, 1.20<length/width<1.55................................................ 17

17 Body small, ca. 6 mm ; eyes distinctly large, over half of temple length..........................
M. oculatus (Bordoni)
- Body medium sized, over 6 mm ; eyes medium sized, ca. 1/3 of temple length..................................... 18
18 Dorsal surface of head sparsely punctate, interspaces between punctures over two punctures’ diameter................. 19
- Dorsal surface of head normally punctate, interspaces between punctures distinctly shorter than two punctures’ diameter.. 20

19 Admedian row of pronotum consisting of 9–11 punctures.....................
M. ailaoshanensis Zhou & Zhou
,
sp. nov.

- Admedian row of pronotum of 16–17 punctures, mixed with some smaller punctures besides.........
M. hayashii (Bordoni)

20 Frontal region on head wrinkled, with three paired punctures.................................
M. hunanensis Bordoni
- Frontal region on head not wrinkled, with small, densely-distributed punctures.................................... 21

22 Inner sac tape-like, coiled 3–4 times......................................................
M. eremiticus Bordoni

- Inner sac not tape-like, irregularly bearing overlapped spines....................................
M. flavus (Bordoni)

23 Inner sac composing of four groups of symmetrical scales, central two groups 8-shaped, lateral two of four paired large notched structures.......................................................................
M. boki (Bordoni)

24 Basal 1/3 of inner sac with large paired spines............................................
M. montanicus (Bordoni)

keyStep.keyLead:
25 Anterial half of head sparsely punctate, not bearing numerous small punctures...................
M. anhuensis (Bordoni)

paragraph.keyLead: - Anterial half of head densely punctate, bearing numerous small punctures........................................ 26

keyLead.keyStep:
27 Male tergite X composed of two parts..................................................
M. pervivagus (Bordoni)

paragraph.keyLead:
28 Inner side of male tergite IX bearing stout, dark spines.........................................
M. mirus (Bordoni)
- Inner side of male tergite IX without stout, dark spines....................................................... 29

29 Paramere distinctly slender and long, over half of median lobe of aedeagus length.............
M. ruficaudatus (Cameron)
- Paramere normally long, shorter than half of median lobe of aedeagus length..................................... 30
- Inner sac without spines, possessing scale-like membrane..................................................... 32

31 Antennomere II distinctly longer than III, inner sac with a row of spines, which becoming distinctly larger towards apex.....................................................................................
M . leishanensis (Bordoni)

- Antennomere II equal to length of III, inner sac with two rows of spines, which becoming distinctly larger towards apex.............................................................................
M. hailuogouensis Bordoni
,
sp. nov.

32 Frontal furrows on head subparalleled.....................................................
M. solivagus Bordoni

- Anterior 2/3 part of frontal furrows parallel, rest 1/3 convergent together...........................
M. suffusus (Sharp)
